title: (x) script capitals in American Escrow logo - Nuptial {Evan (self)}
content:
I need some help here with 2 script letters. It appears the connected part of this logo is Vladimir. What about the A and E - does anyone recognize?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [amescrow.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=amescrow.jpg) | 46.92 KB |
author: evan

comments.content: i’m willing to bet it’s hand lettered, altho it’d be nice to be proved wrong.
Ah-hah, Nuptial Script? Nothing like identifying your own post.

The “A” and “E” certainly belong to [Nuptial](http://web.archive.org/web/20050728081216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/nuptial-script/nuptial-script/testdrive.html?s=American+Escrow&p=72), but the lowercase belongs to something else altogether..
edit: whoops, didn’t realize they were only looking for the capitals…
